title: How to Make Varnish Using PVA Glue

steps.title: Set up the area.
steps.content: Set up the area. Cover the work surface with newspaper or other cover to protect it.

steps.title: Use the ration of two thirds glue to one third water.
steps.content: Use the ration of two thirds glue to one third water. The exact amount used will depend on the size of your craft project. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Pour two thirds of an amount of PVA glue into a mixing container.
steps.content: Pour two thirds of an amount of PVA glue into a mixing container. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Pour in a third of water.
steps.content: Pour in a third of water.

steps.title: Mix the two ingredients together thoroughly.
steps.content: Mix the two ingredients together thoroughly. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Apply to the craft object.
steps.content: Apply to the craft object. The varnish goes on white and dries clear. It will protect artwork, decoupage, drawings and decorative elements attached to a craft project. [4] X Research source Use a large artist's paintbrush to apply the PVA glue varnish.
